head.title: FOP 0.20.4 Standards Compliance
head.subtitle: Progress Report on Standard Features Implemented

explanatory.p: One of FOP's design goals is conformance to the W3C XSL-FO 1.0 standard, which specifies three levels of "conformance": basic, extended, and complete. Although FOP does not currently conform to any of these levels, it is nevertheless a useful work-in-progress for many applications. The information presented here demonstrates FOP's progress toward the goal of conformance, which progress consists of implementation of specific objects and properties in the standard. The information presented is useful not only to the developers as a sort of "to do" list, but also for setting proper expectations for users and potential users.
In the tables below, blue indicates support at the specified level of conformance, and red indicates a lack of support.
The following is a summary of FOP's current support for the standard XSL-FO objects.

level-2.name: Declarations and Pagination and Layout Formatting Objects

level-3.name: page-number-citation
level-3.comment: Only works for table of contents without any problems. The case where the page number doesn't fit on a line isn't handled, and any text on the same line and after the page-number might not appear exactly where you want it to.

level-3.name: table-column
level-3.comment: you must explicitly specify column widths

level-3.name: table-cell
level-3.comment: must contain block-level FOs (cannot contain straight character data)

explanatory.p: The following is a summary of FOP's current support for the standard XSL-FO properties. Please note that a number of properties and categories of properties are not supported because they do not apply to documents in visual formats.

level-2.name: Common Border, Padding, and Background Properties

level-3.name: padding-before
level-3.comment: can't be used to make extra space (use indents + spaces instead)
can be used to control how much the background-color extends beyond the content rectangle

level-3.name: font-family
level-3.comment: font-family lists are not supported, use a single font-family name

level-3.name: display-align
level-3.comment: Implemented only for table-cell and block-container.
For table-cell, the "height" attribute must be set for the parent table-row; setting the height of the table or the table-cell results in vertical centering having no effect.

level-3.name: text-align
level-3.comment: Only start, end, center and justify are supported

level-3.name: text-align-last
level-3.comment: Only start, end, center and justify are supported

level-3.name: reference-orientation
level-3.comment: Workaround for page-orientation (portrait vs. landscape) is to swap the page-width and page-height properties.
Workaround for block-container is to use SVG.

level-3.name: leader-length
level-3.comment: leader-length.minimum is not used at all

level-2.name: Properties for Dynamic Effects Formatting Objects
Properties for Number to String Conversion

level-3.name: column-width
level-3.comment: "percentage" not implemented. Workaround is to use the XSL-FO "proportional-column-width" function.

level-3.name: padding
level-3.comment: can't be used to make extra space (use indents + spaces instead)
can be used to control how much the background-color extends beyond the content rectangle
